description: firstPart is the value of the first element
code:
const replaceComponents = ['sensor', 'battery', 'motor', 'brain']
let robotParts = [
  'motor',
  'sensor',
  'battery',
  'camera',
  // 'memory', ??
]
const swapComponents = ['sensor', 'battery', 'motor']

// Your code

equal(firstPart, 'motor')

description: firstPart is the value of the first element even if we change the list
code:

  'camera',
  'battery',
  // 'memory', ??
]

description: comboParts is an array of lastPart and firstPart
code:

  'motor',
  'sensor',
  'battery',
  'camera',
  // 'memory', ??
]

equal(comboParts, ['camera', 'motor'])

description: comboParts is an array of lastPart and firstPart even if we change the list
code:

  'sensor',
  'motor',
  'camera',
  'battery',
  // 'memory', ??
]

  'motor',
  'sensor',

  // 'memory', ??
]

const replaceComponents = ['sensor', 'battery', 'motor', 'brain']

equal(replaceComponents, ['sensor', 'battery', 'enhanced', 'brain'])

description: 1st and 2nd elements of swapComponents are swapped pif,paf,pom
code:

let robotParts = [
  'motor',
  'sensor',
  'camera',
  'battery',
  // 'memory', ??
]
